problem_text: 6.59. A group G is said to be (conjugacy, p-conjugacy) biprimitively finite if, for any finite subgroup H, any two elements of prime order (any two conjugate elements of prime order, of prime order p) in N_G(H)/H generate a finite subgroup. Prove that an arbitrary periodic (conjugacy) biprimitively finite group (in particular, having no involutions) of finite rank is locally finite. V. P. Shunkov
